Lead end-to-end data science projects from problem definition to deployment, collaborating with cross-functional teams to identify opportunities and develop actionable insights.
Design and implement advanced machine learning algorithms and statistical models to solve complex business problems, such as predictive modeling, customer segmentation, and recommendation systems.

Strong theoretical foundation in machine learning algorithms and statistical modeling techniques, with practical experience in applying them to real-world problems.
Experience working with big data technologies (e.g., Hadoop, Spark) and cloud computing platforms (e.g., AWS, Azure, GCP).
Excellent problem-solving skills and the ability to think creatively to develop innovative solutions to complex problems.
Strong communication and presentation skills, with the ability to effectively communicate technical concepts to non-technical stakeholders.
Proven leadership abilities, with experience leading cross-functional teams and mentoring junior team members.

Experience with deep learning frameworks such as TensorFlow or PyTorch.
Knowledge of natural language processing (NLP) techniques and tools.
Experience with A/B testing methodologies and experimental design.

Strong project management skills, with the ability to manage multiple priorities and deadlines effectively.

Job Description:
We are looking for a highly skilled and innovative Computer Vision Engineer to join our growing team. In this role, you will be reporting to our Lead Data Scientist, being at the forefront of cutting-edge technology, working with customer data and when needed synthetic data to train computer vision algorithms on edge cases that have very important real-world implications. Your expertise will be instrumental in advancing our computer vision platform and helping deliver maximum value to our clients.

Key Responsibilities
As a Computer Vision Engineer, you will have a critical role in designing, implementing, and deploying computer vision algorithms and systems that will drive innovation within our clients organizations.
Computer Vision Algorithm Development: Design, develop, and optimize computer vision algorithms for various applications, including object detection, image segmentation, and image recognition.
Data Handling and Annotation: Expertise in data preprocessing, augmentation, and annotation for computer vision tasks, enabling the effective preparation of datasets for training and evaluation.
Model Training and Evaluation: Proficiency in training and fine-tuning computer vision models, along with establishing robust evaluation methodologies to assess model accuracy and performance effectively.
Model Deployment and Optimization: Must have the ability to deploy computer vision systems into production environments, ensuring scalability, reliability, and optimization for real-time and resource-constrained use cases.
Integration: Collaborate with software engineers and cross-functional teams to integrate computer vision solutions into different workflows for our customers
Required Qualifications
Bachelors or Master s degree in computer science, computer engineering, electrical engineering or a related field.
Programming Skills: High Proficiency in programming languages such as Python, for algorithm development and scripting.
Deep Learning: Proficiency in deep learning frameworks and architectures, including a strong command of CNNs, RNNs, VAEs and GANs, Transformers with the capability to apply these techniques to solve complex computer vision problems.
Deep familiarity with computer vision libraries, such as OpenCV, TensorFlow, or PyTorch.
Good understanding of data handling, including data preprocessing and annotation for computer vision tasks.
Knowledge of computer vision best practices and the ability to troubleshoot and fine-tune computer vision models for performance and accuracy.
Excellent problem-solving and analytical skills, with a track record of delivering innovative solutions in the field of computer vision.
Willingness and ability to collaborate with cross-functional teams and to learn and adapt to new tools and techniques.
Preferred Qualifications
Masters or Ph.D. in computer science, computer engineering, or a related field.
Experience with model deployment in production environments, ensuring scalability and reliability.
Experience or interest in Large Language Models.
Proficiency in additional programming languages, such as C/C++, CUDA for GPU acceleration and parallel processing.
Experience
A minimum of 4-6 years of experience in computer vision development and research.
Education
Bachelors or Master s degree and preferably PhD in computer science, electrical engineering or computer vision related field.
Education:
UG: Any Graduate
PG: CA in CA, Any Postgraduate
Key Skills: Process automation, Computer science, Electrical engineering, Computer vision, C++, Aviation, Algorithm development, Programming, Genetics, Python

Job Description:
We are seeking an experienced Data Scientist with a minimum of 5 years of expertise in data modeling and analysis. They must be highly proficient with statistical analysis of data (exploratory data analysis), and visualising key results. They should be able to identify opportunities for data science models which could be produced within a dataset, and produce examples using common python libraries such as SKLearn. For any produced model, they must also be able to deploy the model in the cloud, with lambda functions or sagemaker endpoints. Familiarity with normal software development practices such as git, pull requests, and use of different branches and environments is also important.

Key Responsibilities

Given a new dataset, visualise statistical patterns and investigate the feasibility of model development
Design and deploy supervised models from the datasets, including classical logic and rule-based systems where appropriate
Analyze large datasets to extract actionable insights and support data-driven decision-making.
Collaborate with data engineers, analysts, and other stakeholders to understand data needs and deliver solutions that meet business requirements.
Be able to work locally and in AWS depending on the data connectivity and compute requirements
Document progress and write confluence documentation for models, their purpose, and examples of usage
Qualifications

Experience: 5+ years of experience as a Data Scientist or in a similar role.

Technical Skills:
Excellent core python skills, including object oriented programming
Strong usage of data science python libraries such as XGBoost, SKLearn, LiteGBM, Matplotlib and others
Practical experience with AWS Lambda as a compute option for deployed code
Familiarity with machine learning algorithms and data analysis techniques.
Analytical Skills :
Ability to analyze complex datasets and provide meaningful insights.

Problem-Solving: Strong troubleshooting skills to resolve issues in data pipelines and workflows.
Collaboration: Excellent teamwork skills, with the ability to work effectively with cross-functional teams.
Adaptability: Ability to thrive in a fast-paced, dynamic environment with evolving requirements.

Preferred Skills
Familiarity with additional AWS services and cloud-based data solutions.
Experience with other AWS cloud compute options such as EC2 and ECS/EKS.
Understanding of data security and compliance best practices.

Job Title: NLP Data Scientist - Real World Data (RWD)
Location: Kolkata, Mumbai, New Delhi, Hyderabad, Pune, Chennai, Bengaluru
Job Description:
Minimum Qualification : B. Tech. (or equivalent) from an accredited institution
Indicative Experience : 7+ Years
  Job Description:
We are seeking a skilled NLP data scientist with a focus on language models to join our AI and Life Sciences Solutions team. Your expertise in processing and understanding natural language data, along with your knowledge of Electronic Health Records (EHR) and laboratory report analysis, will be instrumental in driving our data science initiatives and innovations, particularly in the development of rich multimodal real-world datasets to expedite RWD-driven drug development in pharma.
  Responsibilities:
Employ and leverage NLP and open-source Large Language Models (LLM) such as LLama2, Mixtral, BERT, etc., to extract, process, and interpret unstructured medical data from diverse sources like EHRs, medical notes, and laboratory reports.
Collaborate with clinical scientists and data scientists to create efficient NLP models for healthcare, exhibiting an understanding of both the technical and medical aspects of the data.
Conduct data cleaning, preprocessing, and validation to maintain the accuracy and reliability of insights gathered from NLP processes.
Validate and present data findings to stakeholders, exhibiting clear and effective communication skills

Required Skills/Qualifications:
Masters or Ph.D. degree in Computer Science, Data Science, Computational Linguistics, or a related analytical field.
Deep understanding and direct experience (2+ years) in handling and interpreting electronic health records (EHR) and laboratory test results are a must.
Proven experience (2+ years) in NLP with a strong knowledge of NLP techniques such as Named Entity Recognition (NER), text summarization, topic modelling, etc. and their applied use in healthcare.
Expert-level understanding and practical experience (1+ years) with Large Language Models (LLM), e.g., inference and fine-tuning.
Proficient in Python and SQL, with strong experience in NLP libraries such as NLTK, SpaCy, Hugging Face Transformers, and deep learning libraries such as PyTorch and TensorFlow.
Familiarity with common data science and ML practices, e.g., version control systems, agile methodologies, and documentation.
Experience working with the AWS cloud environment and large databases (e.g., AWS Redshift).
Experience in managing the ML lifecycle using open-source tools (e.g., MLflow).
Detail-oriented with strong analytical and problem-solving abilities.
Excellent verbal and written communication skills, with the ability to present complex data to non-technical audience.

Preferred Qualifications:
Experience dealing with protected health information (PHI) and familiarity with healthcare-related data privacy laws such as HIPAA.
Familiarity with standard healthcare codes and terminologies such as ICD-10, CPT, LOINC, and SNOMED CT.
Experience in RAG (Retrieval-Augmented Generation) and vector storage in the context of storing a large volume of healthcare unstructured documents and querying those.
Education:
UG: Any Graduate
PG: Any Postgraduate, LLM in Law
Key Skills: Computer science, Health insurance, Pharma, Analytical, Agile, Healthcare, Life sciences, Open source, SQL, Python

Job Purpose:

The Data Analyst for Supply Chain Management (Logistics) will play a critical role in analyzing, optimizing, and supporting the logistics and supply chain operations through data-driven insights. The role involves collecting, interpreting, and visualizing logistics data to enhance decision-making processes, improve operational efficiency, and reduce costs across the supply chain.

Key Responsibilities:
Perform descriptive, diagnostic, and predictive analysis to assess logistics performance metrics such as delivery times, shipping costs, and inventory levels
Identify trends, patterns, and anomalies in supply chain operations and recommend process improvements.
Develop and maintain dashboards and reports to monitor key performance indicators (KPIs) related to logistics and supply chain.
Present data insights and recommendations to the supply chain and logistics team, ensuring complex data is translated into actionable business insights.
Regularly report on areas such as cost efficiency, delivery accuracy, order fulfillment, and lead times.
Analyze transportation routes, warehouse operations, and processes to identify opportunities for cost reduction and efficiency improvements.

Qualifications and Requirements:
Any bachelor degree
Proven experience as a Data Analyst in supply chain, logistics, or a related field.
Proficiency in data analysis tools such as Excel, SQL, Power BI, Tableau
Strong understanding of supply chain processes and logistics operations.

Experience :

Minimum 5 years to 10 years

Preferred:

Certification in Data Analytics

Job Description:
About the role
We are hiring for a Reporting Analyst to drive our clients customer experience analytics and help them craft the next chapter of customer engagement and retention. In this transformational role as Reporting Analyst of Customer Experience Analytics, reporting to the VP of Customer Experience Analytics, you'll be at the epicenter of data-driven decision-making.

You'll be at the forefront of a rapidly evolving customer relationship management environment, working collaboratively with a team of professionals dedicated to defining the future of interaction management. By leveraging your unique blend of analytical capability and industry knowledge, youll unlock insights from customer and interaction data to enhance overall customer experience, drive business growth and maximize Customer Lifetime Value.

Role & responsibilities
Strategic Analytics: Leverage statistics and data science to create models to understand our customers behaviors focusing on customer experience, satisfaction, loyalty, and retention across multiple platforms (voice, chat, SMS, app, web). Develop predictive models to anticipate customer behavior, identify trends and proactively address potential issues or opportunities.
CLV Integration: Holistically evaluate customer interactions impact to customer lifetime value.
Impact Analysis: Develop segmentation, classification, and statistical analyses to measure the impact of actions on CLV.
Collaboration: Interface cross-functionally with various teams, including Data Warehousing, Data Science, Product, and Customer Experience.
Insights: Leverage the latest in cloud technologies to amplify your analytical depth, especially focused on applied machine learning.

Preferred candidate profile
5+ years of experience in data analysis and reporting.

Technical Skills:
Proficiency in programming languages such as Python or R.
Familiarity with data manipulation libraries and tools, like Pandas, NumPy, and data visualization libraries like Matplotlib or Seaborn.
Experience with SQL for querying and managing relational databases.
Proficiency in Google Cloud Platform.

Statistical Knowledge:
Understanding of statistical concepts and techniques, including hypothesis testing, regression analysis, and probability theory

Data Wrangling & Visualization:
Ability to clean and preprocess data, handling missing values, outliers, and data inconsistencies.
Proficiency in data transformation techniques to prepare data for analysis.
Understanding of data storytelling to effectively communicate insights to non-technical stakeholders.
Intermediate to advance PowerPoint presentation skills; Tableau & ThinkCell is a plus.

Tools and Software:
Proficiency in using data analysis and visualization software such as Jupyter Notebooks, Excel, or equivalent tools.
Knowledge of data storage technologies, such as relational databases and NoSQL databases, and how to access and extract data from them.
Communication Skills & Problem-Solving Abilities:
Strong written and verbal communication skills are essential to convey complex data findings to non-technical stakeholders.
Collaboration and teamwork skills to work effectively with cross-functional teams.
Analysts should be able to identify business problems, formulate data-driven hypotheses, and develop solutions based on data analysis.
Education: UG: Any Graduate
Key Skills: GCP, Tableau, ETL, SQL

Job Description:
efficiencyJob Title: Data Analyst
Company Overview: Established in 1984, our company has thrived as a dynamic Export and Trading House with a primary focus on textiles and textile intermediaries. Over the years, our journey has traversed diverse business domains. Currently, we are excited to announce opportunities within our young and rapidly growing Outsourced Services (Knowledge, Business & Finance) division, which was inaugurated in early '23. Our client is a fast-growing ntech SaaS company that makes a leading cloud-based platform for the private lending industry. This platform enables lenders to service loans, originate loans, lower servicing costs, and expedite the closing process while ensuring the highest levels of compliance, quality, and eiciency.
Join us and be part of a dynamic team at the forefront of nancial technology innovation, where your work directly impacts the future of lending.
Position Overview: We are seeking a skilled Data Analyst to join our team. The ideal candidate will have a
few years of experience in data analysis, with a strong ability to translate data into actionable insights that
drive business decisions. This role is critical in helping our Client understand customer behaviors,
optimize operations, and support the growth of their loan servicing and origination platform.
Key Responsibilities:
• Data Analysis and Reporting:
o Analyze large datasets to extract meaningful insights and trends.
o Develop and maintain dashboards, reports, and visualizations to monitor key performance
metrics.
o Present ndings and recommendations to stakeholders in a clear and concise manner.
• Data Management:
o Ensure data accuracy, integrity, and consistency across multiple systems.
o Collaborate with engineering and product teams to improve data collection processes and
data quality.
o Assist in the development of data models and schemas to support analytical needs.
• Business Insights:
o Work closely with product managers to identify data-driven opportunities.
o Conduct in-depth analyses of customer behavior, loan performance, and other key metrics
to support strategic initiatives.
Provide ad-hoc analyses to answer specic business questions and support decision-
making.
• Product Analytics
o Expand and optimize our Clients implementation of a recently purchased 3rd party product
analytics solution
o Work with Product Managers to create dashboards and workows to gain insights into how
our Clients customers are using the product
Qualications:
• Experience:
o 2-4 years of experience in a data analyst role, preferably in the ntech or nancial services
industry.
o Proven experience with data visualization tools such as Tableau, Power BI, or similar.
o Experience with SQL for querying databases and performing complex data manipulation is
a plus
• Technical Skills:
o Prociency in Excel, including advanced functions and data analysis techniques.
o Understanding of data warehousing concepts and familiarity with tools like AWS Redshift,
Google BigQuery, or similar.
o Working knowledge of business analytics tools such as Sisense, and of product analytics
tools such as Pendo.
• Analytical Skills:
o Strong analytical mindset with the ability to identify trends, patterns, and insights from
complex datasets.
o Ability to translate business requirements into data-driven solutions.
o Excellent problem-solving skills and attention to detail.
• Communication Skills:
o Strong verbal and written communication skills with the ability to explain complex data
concepts to non-technical stakeholders.
Notice Period should be 30-45 days maximum.
Role would be On-Site from Sector V (Salt Lake), Kolkata.
Shift timings would be partial night shift, 5:30pm to 2:30am (US Pacic Time zone).efficiency

Job Description:
Role & responsibilities :

Lead the collection, cleaning, and validation of large datasets from various sources, ensuring data integrity and accuracy.
Conduct advanced data analysis to identify trends, patterns, and correlations within complex datasets.
Develop and refine statistical models and machine learning algorithms to predict business outcomes and customer behaviour
Design, build, and maintain interactive dashboards and reports using tools like Tableau, Power BI, or similar.
Provide data-driven insights and recommendations to support strategic business decisions across departments, including marketing, sales, and product development.
Translate complex data findings into clear, actionable insights for non-technical stakeholders.
Partner with business leaders to understand their needs and translate them into analytical solutions.
providing technical leadership and best practices in data analysis and reporting.
Identify opportunities to improve data collection, processing, and analysis methods to enhance efficiency and accuracy.

Essential Skillset:

7+ years experience in a data analytics or engineering role with a solid understanding of technical, business, and operational process requirements
SQL: Proficiency in SQL is crucial for querying databases, extracting data, and performing data manipulation tasks.
Excel: Advanced skills in Excel, including pivot tables, VLOOKUP, and data analysis functions.
Python: Used for data manipulation, analysis, and creating scripts for automation. Libraries such as Pandas, NumPy, and Matplotlib are commonly used.
R: Another popular language for statistical analysis and data visualization.
Tableau/Power BI: Experience with these tools for creating interactive dashboards and reports.
Data Visualization Libraries: Knowledge of libraries like Matplotlib, Seaborn (Python), or ggplot2 (R) for visualizing data trends and patterns.
Descriptive and Inferential Statistics: Understanding measures like mean, median, variance, standard deviation, and hypothesis testing.
Regression Analysis: Proficiency in linear and logistic regression, as well as understanding other predictive modelling techniques.
Data Interpretation: Ability to interpret complex datasets and draw meaningful insights that can inform business decisions.
Critical Thinking: Strong problem-solving skills, enabling the analyst to approach data challenges logically and creatively.
Attention to Detail: Ensuring accuracy and consistency in data analysis, spotting anomalies, and correcting them.
Domain Knowledge: Understanding the industry and specific business context to make data-driven recommendations that align with business goals.
KPI Development: Ability to define, measure, and analyse key performance indicators (KPIs) relevant to the business.
Data Storytelling: Ability to present complex data findings in a clear, concise, and engaging way, making insights accessible to non-technical stakeholders.
Report Writing: Strong written communication skills for creating detailed reports that explain the analysis process, findings, and recommendations.
Presentation Skills: Proficiency in delivering impactful presentations, often using visual aids, to communicate insights effectively to senior management and other stakeholders.
Database Management: Experience with databases like MySQL, PostgreSQL, or Oracle for managing and querying large datasets.
Big Data Technologies: Familiarity with big data tools like Hadoop, Spark, or NoSQL databases (e.g., MongoDB) is a plus for handling large-scale data.
ETL Tools: Knowledge of Extract, Transform, Load (ETL) processes and tools like Apache NiFi, Talend, or Informatica for data integration.
Education: UG: Any Graduate
Key Skills: SQL, R, Excel, Power Bi, Big data Tools, Data Visualization, Tableau, Python

Job Description:
Machine learning is a branch of artificial intelligence that allows computer systems to learn directly from examples, data, and experience
Through enabling computers to perform specific tasks intelligently, machine learning systems can carry out complex processes by learning from data, rather than following pre-programmed rules
Data analytics is the science of analyzing raw data from any dataset in order to make conclusions about that information
Many of the techniques and processes of data analytics have been automated into mechanical processes and algorithms that work over raw data for human consumption
Data analytics is a broad term that encompasses many diverse types of data analysis
Any type of information can be subjected to data analytics techniques to get insight that can be used to improve thing
Machine Learning is the field of study that gives computers the capability to learn without being explicitly programmed
ML is one of the most exciting technologies that one would have ever come across
As it is evident from the name, it gives the computer that which makes it more similar to humans: The ability to learn
Machine learning is actively being used today, perhaps in many more places than one would expect
Education:
UG: Any Graduate
PG: Any Postgraduate
Key Skills: Data analysis, Artificial Intelligence, Machine learning, Mechanical, Data analytics, Data Analyst

Job Title: Data Analyst (Immediate To 30 days Joiners Only)
Job Description:
Job Summary:

The Data & Analytics team plays a critical role in the success of our clients. The team identifies actionable and impactful insights through high quality analysis, builds new analytical capabilities and processes, supports effective executive decision making, and maintains accurate dashboards and databases. The team works on our most important analytical questions and operates highly collaboratively with our Marketing, Operations, Product, Finance, Retail, and Strategy teams.
The Data Analyst will lead essential analysis across multiple functions and solve a broad range of critical and complex problems. The role reports directly to Clients Data & Analytics Director.
The ideal candidate will be data-driven, analytical, creative, detail oriented, organized, an effective communicator, and highly collaborative.

Data Informatics Analyst: Generates ad hoc reports and regular datasets or report information for end-users using system tools and database or data warehouse queries and scripts. Incumbents who program and maintain reports as part of broad programming tasks or functions should be matched to Programmer/Analyst (6451-6456) or Enterprisewide Programmer/Analyst (6551-6556). May be internal operations-focused or external client-focused, working in conjunction with Professional Services and outsourcing functions.

  you're GOOD AT :

Assuring proper sign off before uploading materials into internal repository for reference; sanitizing confidential client content in marketing document

Contributes to teams content IP development

Production planning and Queuing, Inventory Optimization, Resource allocation, Routing optimization, Production planning

Analytical skills : You should be strong in analytical solutioning with hands on experience in advanced analytics delivery, through the entire life cycle of analytics. Strong analytics skills with the ability to develop and codify knowledge and provide analytical advice where required.

Job Description:
Job Description
IIRIS is looking for a Data Governance Analyst, working alongside the Data Governance Manager to execute, monitor and design data governance processes (e.g. data access management, data sharing, data catalogue management, reference data, etc.).
As a Data Governance Analyst, you will:
Support IIRIS colleagues and business stakeholders in understanding the Data Governance policies and their responsibilities related to it.
Contribute to and enhance the continuous improvement of the Data Governance framework.
Assist in implementing data governance initiatives such as data classification, data quality, data sharing, access control etc., to ensure data reliability across the business.
Manage and develop data artefacts such as quality rules, business glossary entries, access glossary, data catalogue and policy Inventory.
Validate new or existing data quality test methods and procedures, identify issues, and recommend process improvements.
Review project work backlogs and work on tasks individually or as part of a team, such as data sharing, data quality etc.
Identify data issues in existing processes, systems, and procedures, and leverage change management programs to address them.
Assist with stakeholder engagement by supporting actions, meetings, events, and providing materials such as data quality dashboards to facilitate stakeholder understanding and commitment to remediation actions.
Qualifications
As a Data Governance Analyst at IIRIS, you will be expected:
To have demonstrated experience working with data, preferably within a Data Governance function.
To have demonstrated experience using technical Data Governance tools such as; Collibra, Alation, Informatica etc., and possess hands-on experience with SQL, Excel, PowerBI, and other BI tools.
To have experience collaborating with and presenting to stakeholders at all organizational levels.
To possess excellent communication skills and the ability to work effectively with data & business leaders to address data challenges and issues.
To show initiative by identifying opportunities for process improvement and maintaining curiosity to question the status quo.
Education: UG: Any Graduate
Key Skills: Data Governance, data access management, Data Quality, data catalogue management, Governance, data sharing, reference data, Data Governance Analyst

Job Description:
Bombay Play Data Analyst use our expansive data to deliver fundamental insights on who our audience is, how they engage with our games, and what are the best ways to acquire them. We strive for a better understanding of our players which translates into challenges and features that delight them. Here s where you would come in: identify and formalise problems related to player behaviour and user acquisition. Build analyses and systems to derive insights that change the Product team s world view. Be innovative, be creative, use every bit of that key commodity data. Millions of people play Bombay Play games every month, so our data is tremendously rich, and we have a lot of it!
We will rely on you to communicate your findings to your peers both technical and non-technical. Your solutions to difficult problems will need to be demonstrably impactful, visual and maintainable. You will work with our engineering teams to put your models into production. You will collaborate with User Acquisition Managers, Product Managers, and Engineers to deliver business impact, changing current practices in line with new findings and insights.


KEY ROLES & RESPONSIBILITIES

Job Description:
Who We're Looking For
The Data Analyst is an internal facing professional who supports and provides human oversight for our machine learning Messaging Trust anti-spam/anti-fraud platform. The goal is to help train the machine learning/AI models and develop policies to reduce spam and block fraudulent messages. You will be assisting the Commercial Messaging, Product, and Data Science teams in helping their mobile operator and enterprise partners in protecting their end user customers. Youre passionate about engaging complex problems and driving to answers and resolution. It requires impeccable analytical and investigative skills with focus on details to create win/win results for customers and their customers/end users.

And your behaviors align strongly with our values, because ours do.
Some of What You'll Do
The following are the functions that data analyst performs related to messaging reviews and action:
Perform daily reviews of current messaging Clusters (Patterns)
Review, analyze and determine if there are anomalies (i.e. spam/fraud content showing as ML Ham, messages incorrectly identified as ML Spam, etc.) in current message clustering that may require re-labeling and policy creation.
Take immediate action on Messages/Clusters determined to be Spam/Fraud, not limited to opening a ticket, includes recommendation/creation of new policies or rules.
Additionally, you will:
Be the point of contact for partner/customer facing teams on blocking actions.
Advise the reasons behind message blocking so that future improvements can be made by the customer.
Contribute to the success of the customer management team by reporting metrics back to leadership and customers
Work closely with product and data science teams to understand their measures of success and identify areas for improvement
Monitor success KPIs and report
Maintain product expertise by keeping abreast of technologies as they apply to Syniverse products and services
Requirements
2+ years in customer success or customer service
Detail-oriented with prior customer compliance experience
BS/BA in Business or Marketing
Strong interpersonal, communication and team skills
Strong analytical and problem resolution skills
Works in shifts to provide onsite 24hrs coverage on rotational basis and is flexible to work beyond stipulated hours.
Strong control and follow-up skills
Effective Business writing skills
Education:
UG: B.A
PG: Any Postgraduate
Key Skills: customer success, customer service, customer compliance, Messaging Trust Data Analyst, machine learning

Job Description:
KINDLY READ THE JD CAREFULLY:

Role Overview:
The Data Analyst in Sales Operations will analyze complex sales data, derive actionable insights, and support decision-making processes to enhance sales performance. You will be instrumental in identifying sales trends, optimizing operations, and forecasting future sales to drive the company's growth.

Roles & responsibilities:
Data Collection and Management:
Extract data from various sales databases and CRM systems.
Ensure data integrity by validating and cleaning data from disparate sources.
Maintain and update data repositories with accuracy.

Data Analysis and Reporting:
Utilize statistical techniques to interpret sales data and generate actionable insights.
Create visualizations and reports using tools such as Power BI, Tableau, or Google Data Studio.
Prepare and present reports, dashboards, and visualizations.
Develop and distribute weekly, monthly, and quarterly performance reports to stakeholders.

Sales Performance Metrics:
Track and analyze sales KPIs such as revenue growth, pipeline health, win/loss rates, and customer acquisition cost.
Benchmark sales performance against targets and industry standards.
Monitor sales productivity and efficiency metrics to identify areas for improvement.

Forecasting and Trend Analysis:
Build and refine sales forecasting models using historical data and market trends.
Conduct trend analysis to predict future sales patterns and potential market changes.
Evaluate the impact of seasonal trends, economic conditions, and competitive actions on sales performance.

Process Optimization:
Identify inefficiencies in the sales process and recommend improvements.
Develop and implement strategies to streamline sales workflows and increase operational efficiency.
Collaborate with the sales team to enhance data-driven decision-making.

Cross-Functional Collaboration:
Work closely with sales managers, marketing teams, and finance departments to align data analysis with strategic objectives.
Provide data insights to support sales campaigns, product launches, and promotional activities.
Facilitate meetings to discuss data findings and collaborate on action plans.

Ad-Hoc Analysis:
Address specific business questions and provide timely analysis on various projects.
Support special initiatives by conducting targeted research and analysis.
Present findings and recommendations to senior leadership and other stakeholders.

Required Qualification and Skillset:
At least 2-5 years of experience in a data analysis role, preferably within sales operations or a similar field.
Proven track record of using data to drive business decisions and improvements.
Proficiency in data analysis tools (e.g., Excel, SQL) and data visualization software (e.g., Power BI, Tableau).
Experience with CRM systems (e.g., Hubspot) and sales management tools.
Knowledge of statistical analysis techniques and forecasting methods

Job Description:
Are you a Python enthusiast with a strong background in data analysis? If so, we have the perfect job for you! Torry Harris, a leading IT consulting and services company, is currently seeking a Python Developer Data Analyst to join our team.

Job Title: Python Developer Data Analyst
Company: Torry Harris
Location: Remote or Bangalore, India

Job Description:

As a Python Developer Data Analyst at Torry Harris, you will be responsible for designing, developing, and maintaining Python-based data analysis solutions. You will work closely with our data scientists and business analysts to gather and understand requirements, and then transform them into efficient and scalable Python code.

Key Responsibilities:

1. Develop and maintain Python-based data analysis solutions
2. Collaborate with data scientists and business analysts to understand and fulfill requirements
3. Design and implement data processing and manipulation pipelines
4. Analyze and visualize complex data sets to derive insights and make recommendations
5. Build and maintain data models and algorithms
6. Ensure the security, privacy, and integrity of data
7. Support and troubleshoot data-related issues
8. Stay up to date with the latest trends and technologies in data analysis and Python development

Qualifications:

1. Bachelor's or Master's degree in Computer Science, Statistics, Mathematics, or a related field
2. Proven experience as a Python Developer or Data Analyst
3. Proficiency in Python and its data analysis libraries (e.g. pandas, numpy, matplotlib)
4. Solid understanding of statistical analysis, machine learning, and data visualization
5. Experience with database management systems (e.g. SQL, NoSQL)
6. Strong problem-solving and analytical skills
7. Excellent communication and teamwork abilities
8. Knowledge of cloud platforms, such as AWS or Azure, is a plus

Why Work at Torry Harris:

- Competitive salary and benefits package
- Opportunities for professional development and growth
- Collaborative and inclusive work environment
- Exciting and challenging projects with leading global clients
- Work-life balance and flexible working options

If you are passionate about Python development and data analysis, and want to be part of a dynamic and innovative company, then we want to hear from you! Apply now to join the Torry Harris team and take your career to the next level.

Roles and Responsibilities
The role of a Python Developer Data Analyst is a crucial one in today's data-driven world. This role is responsible for using Python programming language to analyze, interpret, and present data to help organizations make informed decisions. Python Developer Data Analysts play a key role in transforming raw data into actionable insights, allowing businesses to streamline their operations and improve their performance.

Roles and Responsibilities of a Python Developer Data Analyst:

1. Data Collection and Analysis: The primary responsibility of a Python Developer Data Analyst is to collect and analyze large sets of data using Python programming language. This includes cleaning, organizing, and processing data to ensure accuracy and reliability.

2. Developing Data Models: Python Developer Data Analysts are responsible for creating data models and algorithms to extract valuable information from data. This may involve using Python libraries such as Pandas, NumPy, and Scikit-learn to perform statistical analysis, machine learning, and predictive modeling.

3. Data Visualization: Python Developer Data Analysts are tasked with presenting data findings in a clear and understandable manner. They use Python libraries such as Matplotlib, Seaborn, and Plotly to create visualizations and dashboards that communicate complex data insights to non-technical stakeholders.

4. Coding and Scripting: Python Developer Data Analysts write and maintain Python scripts and code to automate data processing tasks and build data pipelines. They use Python’s extensive libraries and tools to create efficient and scalable solutions for handling and manipulating data.

5. Collaboration with Data Science and Engineering Teams: Python Developer Data Analysts work closely with data science and engineering teams to understand project requirements, contribute to data infrastructure design, and ensure that analyses and models are integrated into production systems.

6. Data Management and Security: Python Developer Data Analysts also collaborate with IT and security teams to ensure that data is managed and protected according to company policies and best practices.

7. Staying Up-to-Date with Industry Trends: It is vital for Python Developer Data Analysts to stay updated with the latest trends and developments in data analytics and Python programming. They need to continually learn new tools and techniques to improve their skills and stay competitive in the field.

In conclusion, the role of a Python Developer Data Analyst is multifaceted and demands a blend of technical, analytical, and communication skills. This role is essential for organizations to leverage the power of data to drive business decisions and achieve their strategic goals.

Job Description:
Role Overview
The Data Analyst will have a sixth sense for making sense of the numbers, identifying outliers and providing sound guidance and support to help create and integrate a unified quality strategy into the development process. The successful candidate will have a keen eye for spotting patterns, identifying risk and opportunity and will couple effective communication with a solid technical skillset. If you are looking to grow and face challenges in a fast-paced and ever-evolving environment supporting the design and creation of bleeding edge tools, look no further!
Responsibilities Include:
Assembles data from multiple sources, conducts analyses, performs research, designs, documents and implements analytical solutions.
Develop and maintain scripts and queries to import, manipulate, clean, transform data from different sources.
Presents analysis conclusions in a clear, understandable, and valuable way. Tells compelling stories supported by data using visualization tools (Power BI, Tableau or similar).
Evaluate and interpret data to find risks and opportunities, relaying them to the team and management.
Create best practices in tools and visual technologies to help evolve the project dashboards to provide essential data for project monitoring.
Builds metrics reporting systems and tracks process improvements across the team.
Relay insights in layman's terms and visualize to be used for taking data-driven decisions.
Provide predictive insights to compute newer prediction/data models.
Perform quality assurance on generated and final results to ensure consistency and accuracy.
Skills & Abilities:
2-3 years of professional analytical experience, applying data to improve process improvements.
Programming and Database experienced with advanced SQL skills and experience of other languages such as JavaScript, Python.
Expert in data visualization techniques for charts and reports - good knowledge of Microsoft Power BI and/or Tableau.
Strong knowledge on math and statistical techniques including probability, correlation, regression, classification, and the development of statistical models.
Strong problem solving, creative thinking, and analytical skills.
Knowledge on ML/AI is a plus.
Highly effective communicator both verbally and written.

Job Description:
Data Analyst
As a Data Analyst you will play a key role in analyzing our operational data to improve our Quality Verification strategies for the EA Respawn. You should be a sharp, curious, and analytic individual who has a passion for diving into data to solve business problems. Your insights will influence how we build and verify the quality of our games, and how to improve our business processes through data insights.
The Data Analyst will be responsible for assembling data from multiple sources, conducting analyses, performing research, interacting with different internal customers, designing, documenting, and implementing analytical solutions, as well as compiling and presenting results, in graphical and written summaries, to a variety of audiences. You will be responsible for building metrics reporting systems and for tracking process improvements across the organization. You will excel in a fast-paced environment, managing multiple responsibilities and deadlines in an internationally based team. The ideal candidate would be an effective communicator who combines solid technical skills with pride in excellence, who also demonstrates the potential to grow into a client-facing consulting role and/or an analytical consulting role (i.e. development of simulation models).
What a Data Analyst does at EA:
Assembles data from multiple sources, conducts analyses, performs research, designs, documents and implements analytical solutions.
Presents analysis conclusions to the internal customer in a clear, understandable, and valuable way.
Communicates with team members and business stakeholders.
Presents high quality reports and findings in Power BI or as presentations.
Builds metrics reporting systems and tracks process improvements across the team.
Conducts analysis using statistical software, databases, spreadsheets, and reporting tools
Designs, evaluate and monitor key metrics, understanding root causes of changes in metrics
Develops and maintains scripts and queries to import, manipulate, clean, transform data from different sources
Builds and shares live dashboards and reports complete with user documentation
Builds and trains statistical models for hypothesis testing
Performs quality assurance on generated results to ensure accuracy and consistency
Presents conclusions in a clear and concise way
The next great Data Analyst needs:
Relevant experience 3+ years in a past analytical role.
Expert data visualization techniques for charts and reports - good knowledge of Microsoft Power BI and/or Tableau.
Unstructured Data handling - Know best practices on how to stage unstructured data and properly model it to solve the problem at hand
Must have very good database and SQL knowledge, NoSQL and elastic search - a strong bonus.
Data Analysis - good knowledge of R language, MS Excel mastery, including VBA, PivotTables, and array functions - or other similar tools used for discovering data patterns and correlations through statistical methods.
Good math and analytical skills including statistics, simulation, and optimization.
We Thought You Might Also Want to Know:
Where we are locatedHyderabad.
Make sure you are following our Facebook page Electronic Arts India : People, Games and Careers to be the first one to find out about our news and events.

UG: Any Graduate
PG: Post Graduation Not Required
Key Skills: Data analysis, Simulation, Consulting, power bi, HTML, Data Analyst, data visualization, microsoft, Operations, SQL

Job Description:
Responsible for collecting, refining, and analysing sales data.

Responsibilities
1. Data Collection and Analysis: Gathering sales data from various sources,
cleaning and organizing the data, and analysing it to identify trends, patterns,
and insights.
2. Reporting: Generating regular reports on sales performance, including key
metrics such as revenue, sales volume, and market share. Presenting findings to
stakeholders in a clear and understandable manner.
3. Forecasting: Using historical data and statistical methods to forecast future sales
trends and outcomes, helping the sales team make informed decisions and set
achievable targets.
4. Data Visualization: Creating visual representations of sales data, such as charts,
graphs, and dashboards, to facilitate understanding and interpretation by non-
technical stakeholders.
5. Identifying Opportunities: Proactively identifying opportunities for sales growth
and optimization based on data analysis, such as identifying underperforming
products or regions with untapped potential.
6. Collaboration: Working closely with sales teams, marketing teams, and other
departments to understand business objectives and provide data-driven insights
and recommendations.
7. Continuous Improvement: Continuously evaluating and refining data collection
processes, analytical methods, and reporting techniques to improve accuracy,
efficiency, and relevance of insights.
Technical Skills : Proficiency in data analysis tools such as Excel, SQL, and statistical
software packages (e.g., Python, R). Familiarity with CRM systems (e.g., Salesforce)
and data visualization tools (e.g., Tableau) is often required.
Education:
UG: Any Graduate
PG: Any Postgraduate
Key Skills: Data Analyst

Job Description:
Project Role :DevOps Engineer

Project Role Description :Responsible for building and setting up new development tools and infrastructure utilizing knowledge in continuous integration, delivery, and deployment (CI/CD), Cloud technologies, Container Orchestration and Security. Build and test end-to-end CI/CD pipelines, ensuring that systems are safe against security threats.
Must have skills :Cloud Automation DevOps

Good to have skills :NA
Minimum 2 year(s) of experience is required

Educational Qualification :15 years full time education
Summary:
As a DevOps Engineer, you will be responsible for building and setting up new development tools and infrastructure utilizing knowledge in continuous integration, delivery, and deployment (CI/CD), Cloud technologies, Container Orchestration and Security. You will build and test end-to-end CI/CD pipelines, ensuring that systems are safe against security threats. Your typical day will involve working with various teams to implement and maintain the infrastructure, automating processes, and troubleshooting any issues that arise.

Roles & Responsibilities:
- Expected to perform independently and become an SME.
- Required active participation/contribution in team discussions.
- Contribute in providing solutions to work related problems.
- Collaborate with development teams to design and implement CI/CD pipelines.
- Automate infrastructure provisioning and configuration management using tools like Terraform and Ansible.
- Implement and maintain monitoring and alerting systems to ensure high availability and performance.
- Troubleshoot and resolve issues related to infrastructure, deployments, and security.
- Stay up-to-date with the latest industry trends and best practices in DevOps and Cloud technologies.

Professional & Technical Skills:
- Must To Have Skills:Proficiency in Cloud Automation DevOps.
- Experience with CI/CD tools such as Jenkins or GitLab.
- Strong knowledge of Cloud platforms like AWS, Azure, or GCP.
- Hands-on experience with containerization technologies like Docker and Kubernetes.
- Solid understanding of infrastructure-as-code principles and tools like Terraform.
- Good To Have Skills:Experience with scripting languages like Python or Bash.

Additional Information:
- The candidate should have a minimum of 2 years of experience in Cloud Automation DevOps.
- This position is based at our Bengaluru office.
- A 15 years full time education is required.

Qualifications

15 years full time education

UG: B.Tech/B.E. in Any Specialization
PG: Any Postgraduate

Job Description:
Financial Wellness is essential to the sustainable development of families around the globe. However, most of the global population struggles to achieve financial health and wellness, which directly impacts their ability to foster economic growth, build sustainable families and communities, and improve financial literacy. Finwell leverages proprietary technology and AI-driven analysis to deliver comprehensive financial wellness and health solutions to everyone. Its platform enables individuals to assess their financial health and receive actionable insights to enhance their financial well-being. Finwell offers this service as an employee benefit to numerous corporations in India and internationally. It also partners with large financial institutions to help their clients achieve financial wellness. Our cutting-edge technology has earned several prestigious awards, including Top 35 Fintech Companies in Asia by Finovate and Top 50 Emerging Startups by NASSCOM.
You'll be working with a highly talented team with extensive experience in product design, engineering, operations, and marketing. Operating in a startup environment means you'll need to dive deep into details, take ownership of tasks, and be ready to build and lead a growing team over time.
We are seeking a bright and exceptional DevOps Engineer based in Hyderabad.

What youll do day-to-day
Define deployment and infrastructure requirements with a focus on cost optimization
Design Oracle Cloud Infrastructure that is auto-scalable and highly secure
Design, deploy, and manage Oracle-based infrastructure, along with monitoring and analysis

Who were looking for
3+ years of strong hands-on experience in Oracle Cloud tools and technologies such as IAM, Compute, Container Engine for Kubernetes (OKE), CI/CD, Jenkins, Maven, VCN, Block Volumes, Docker, GitHub, and Kubernetes is essential
Experience with Linux, infrastructure as code, and networking/security concepts across all layers
Previous experience deploying Java Spring-based microservices in Kubernetes with autoscaling
Expertise in building CI/CD pipelines and automating the deployment process
Familiarity with Oracle databases and scaling strategies
A willingness to learn, adapt, and effectively communicate with stakeholders

Ideal candidate traits
Work collaboratively in a fast-paced, matrixed environment with a steep learning curve and ample opportunities for growth
Show resilience in ambiguous situations, go the extra mile to make an impact, and come up with creative and innovative solutions
Possess high integrity, able to handle sensitive and confidential matters
Understand both the why and the how,’ and use this insight along with strong business acumen to create new processes for the dynamic world of fintech
Exhibit excellent communication and interpersonal skills, collaborating effectively with both internal and external stakeholders to ensure successful outcomes

We are committed to fostering a diverse and inclusive environment and are proud to be an Equal Employment Opportunity Employer. All qualified applicants will be considered for employment without discrimination based on age, race, color, religion, national origin, sexual orientation, gender or gender identity, disability, veteran status, or any other legally protected characteristics. We value diversity, equity, and inclusion, and we encourage individuals from a wide range of backgrounds to apply.

Job Description:
Job Role: DevOps Engineer

Location: Hyderabad
Desired Experience: 4-6 years of experience in DevOps, with a focus on infrastructure management, CI/CD pipelines, and automation.
Education: Bachelors degree in Computer Science, Information Technology, or a related field.

Role Overview
We are seeking a talented and experienced DevOps Engineer to join our dynamic team at Acads360, a leading SaaS product-based company. The ideal candidate will play a crucial role in bridging the gap between software development and IT operations, ensuring seamless deployment, continuous integration, and continuous delivery of our software products. This position requires a deep understanding of both development and operational processes, with a strong focus on automation, scalability, and reliability.

Key Responsibilities
Infrastructure Management: Design, build, and maintain scalable, reliable infrastructure to support our applications using cloud services (AWS, Azure, GCP).
CI/CD Pipelines: Develop, implement, and manage continuous integration and continuous delivery (CI/CD) pipelines to automate the deployment process.
Monitoring and Logging: Implement monitoring, logging, and alerting systems to ensure the health and performance of our applications.
Configuration Management: Use configuration management tools (e.g., Ansible, Puppet, Chef) to manage and deploy system configurations.
Collaboration: Work closely with development teams to integrate DevOps best practices and ensure seamless code releases.
Security: Implement security best practices to protect our applications and data.
Performance Tuning: Optimize system performance and troubleshoot issues to ensure high availability and reliability.
Documentation: Maintain comprehensive documentation of the infrastructure, processes, and best practices.

Qualifications
Experience: 4-6 years of experience in DevOps, with a focus on infrastructure management, CI/CD pipelines, and automation.
Angular and React: Proficiency in Angular and React development, understanding of front-end frameworks, and ability to support development teams in these technologies.
Cloud Platforms: Hands-on experience with cloud platforms such as AWS, Azure, or Google Cloud Platform.
Containerization: Experience with containerization technologies such as Docker and orchestration tools like Kubernetes.
Scripting: Strong scripting skills in languages such as Python, Bash, or PowerShell.
Version Control: Proficiency with version control systems like Git.
Problem-Solving: Excellent problem-solving skills and the ability to work under pressure in a fast-paced environment.
Communication: Strong verbal and written communication skills, with the ability to collaborate effectively with cross-functional teams.

Preferred Skills
Automation Tools: Experience with Jenkins, GitLab CI/CD, or similar tools.
Infrastructure as Code (IaC): Knowledge of Terraform, CloudFormation, or similar IaC tools.
Network Management: Understanding of network protocols, firewalls, VPNs, and load balancers.
Agile Methodologies: Familiarity with Agile development practices and tools like Jira.

Job Description:
Sr Devops Engineer
Job Title: Senior Devops Engineer
Location: Bengaluru, Karnataka
Job Type: Full-time
Experience: 5-8 years

Summary:
We are looking for a highly skilled and experienced Senior DevOps Engineer to lead and manage our DevOps initiatives. The ideal candidate will have extensive expertise in AWS, Linux Administration, CI/CD pipelines, infrastructure automation, and cloud implementations. This role requires strong leadership skills, technical proficiency, and a proven track record in implementing scalable and reliable systems.

Key Responsibilities:
•      Leadership & Strategy: Provide technical leadership and strategic direction for DevOps practices, tools, and methodologies. Mentor junior team members and foster a culture of continuous improvement.
•      Infrastructure Automation: Design, implement, and manage automated infrastructure provisioning, configuration management, and deployment solutions using tools like Terraform, Ansible, or Cloud Formation.
•      Continuous Integration and Deployment: Oversee the design and implementation of CI/CD pipelines using tools such as Jenkins, GitLab CI/CD, Docker, Kubernetes, and EKS. Ensure efficient and reliable delivery of software updates and releases.
•      Cloud Management: Lead efforts in managing and optimizing cloud resources on AWS, including EC2, S3, VPC, ECS, EBS, CloudWatch, and IAM. Implement cost-effective and scalable cloud solutions.
•      Monitoring and Performance: Establish monitoring, logging, and alerting solutions using tools like ELK Stack, Grafana, Kibana, and CloudWatch to ensure system health, performance, and security.
•      Security and Compliance: Implement and maintain security best practices, conduct security audits, vulnerability assessments, and ensure compliance with industry standards and regulations (e.g., PCI-DSS).
•      Collaboration: Work closely with cross-functional teams, including software developers, operations, QA, and business stakeholders to streamline processes, improve efficiency, and deliver high-quality solutions.
•      Incident Response and Troubleshooting: Lead efforts in resolving production incidents or outages, conducting root cause analysis, and implementing preventive measures to minimize future occurrences.
•      Documentation: Create and maintain comprehensive technical documentation related to infrastructure, processes, configurations, and best practices.

Qualifications:
•      Bachelors degree in Computer Science, Engineering, or a related field; or equivalent work experience.
•      Minimum of 6 years of experience in AWS, DevOps, Linux Administration, and related technologies.
•      Proven expertise in CI/CD pipelines, infrastructure automation, cloud management, and security.
•      Strong proficiency in scripting languages (e.g., Shell, Python) and version control systems (e.g., GitHub, GitLab).
•      Experience with containerization technologies (e.g., Docker, Kubernetes) and orchestration tools (e.g., EKS).
•      Excellent leadership, communication, and collaboration skills.
•      Relevant certifications (e.g., AWS Certified DevOps Engineer, Certified Kubernetes Administrator) are a plus.

Key Skills: AWS, Jenkins, Deploying Applications, Ci Cd Pipeline, Aws Devops, Docker, Github, Deployment And Release Management, Ci/Cd, Gitlab, Devops, Kubernetes

Roles and Responsibilities
Are you interested in pursuing a career as an AWS DevOps Engineer at Visionet Systems? If so, you probably want to know more about the roles and responsibilities that come with this position. In this blog, we'll delve into the key aspects of being an AWS DevOps Engineer at Visionet Systems, so you can gain a better understanding of what this role entails.

Roles and Responsibilities of an AWS DevOps Engineer at Visionet Systems:

1. Designing and implementing AWS infrastructure: As an AWS DevOps Engineer at Visionet Systems, you will be responsible for designing, deploying, and maintaining AWS cloud infrastructure. This includes creating scalable and secure solutions that meet the business needs of our clients.

2. Managing DevOps tools and processes: You will be tasked with managing and improving our DevOps tools and processes, such as CI/CD pipelines, configuration management, and version control systems. This involves automating manual processes and optimizing workflows to streamline software development and deployment.

3. Collaborating with cross-functional teams: In this role, you will collaborate with developers, QA engineers, and system administrators to ensure that the infrastructure and applications are designed and implemented effectively. This includes participating in agile meetings, providing technical guidance, and troubleshooting issues as they arise.

4. Monitoring and troubleshooting: As part of your responsibilities, you will monitor the performance and health of AWS infrastructure, promptly identify and resolve any operational issues, and ensure that systems are running smoothly and efficiently.

5. Implementing security best practices: Security is a top priority at Visionet Systems, and as an AWS DevOps Engineer, you will be responsible for implementing and maintaining security best practices in the AWS environment, including access controls, encryption, and compliance standards.

6. Continuous improvement and learning: Staying current with the latest AWS technologies, tools, and best practices is vital in this role. You will be expected to continuously improve your skills and knowledge, and be proactive in identifying opportunities to enhance our DevOps processes and infrastructure.

In summary, being an AWS DevOps Engineer at Visionet Systems involves designing and managing AWS infrastructure, implementing DevOps best practices, collaborating with cross-functional teams, monitoring and troubleshooting, and prioritizing security and continuous improvement. If you are passionate about AWS and DevOps, and are looking for a challenging and dynamic role, a career at Visionet Systems as an AWS DevOps Engineer may be the perfect fit for you.

Job Description:
Role & responsibilities
Automate software development, testing, deployment, and infrastructure provisioning using modern tools like Jenkins, Ansible, Terraform, and container technologies (Docker, Kubernetes) to enable rapid, reliable, and scalable application delivery.
Demonstrate deep expertise in Infrastructure as Code (IaC) concepts, cloud platforms like AWS, and security practices to manage infrastructure in a scalable, secure, and version-controlled manner throughout the development and deployment lifecycle.
Drive end-to-end automation initiatives, leading the creation, optimization, and orchestration of CI/CD pipelines, testing frameworks, infrastructure provisioning, and the overall software delivery lifecycle, while owning the tools, infrastructure, and processes bridging development and operations for seamless collaboration.
Set up, maintain, and optimize monitoring, logging, and alerting systems, infrastructure as code, and configuration management to ensure the reliability, consistency, and overall health of applications and infrastructure.
Foster and champion the adoption of Infrastructure as Code (IaC) practices across teams, creating and maintaining infrastructure code to enable scalability, consistency, high availability, and optimal performance.
Leverage and promote the use of tools like Terraform, AWS CloudFormation, and Kubernetes for infrastructure as code and container orchestration to support the entire software delivery process.
Design and implement scalable and reliable AWS infrastructure, including EC2, Auto Scaling, Load Balancing, EKS, ECS, Docker, and VPC, to support applications..
Architect and maintain Terraform modules to describe and manage infrastructure as code, ensuring consistency and repeatability across environments, and implement CI/CD solutions (e.g., Jenkins, Bitbucket Pipelines, AWS CodePipeline/CodeDeploy) for micro-services-based applications. 

Preferred candidate profile
Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Software Engineering, or a related field, with 6+ years of proven experience in a DevOps or Cloud Engineering role. 
Extensive hands-on experience with Amazon Web Services (AWS) and its core services, including EC2, EKS, ECS, ElasticBeanstalk, AutoScaling, S3, ElasticSearch, ElasticCache, Load Balancers, VPC, Lambda, CloudWatch, and CloudTrail, as well as strong networking knowledge and VPC configuration experience. 
Proficient in Kubernetes and Docker, including managing containerised applications in production environments, and knowledgeable about CI/CD concepts and practices with experience in implementing and optimising CI/CD pipelines. 
Excellent communication and leadership skills, with the ability to work effectively with cross-functional teams.
Proficiency in at least two scripting languages (e.g., Bash, Python, or PowerShell), as well as familiarity with version control systems like BitBucket and collaboration platforms like Jira/Confluence.

Job Description:
COMPANY OVERVIEW ABOUT ARCHER SYSTEMS

ARCHER Systems is a leading technology enabled legal services company that provides presettlement and post-settlement administration services for single event, mass tort, and class action cases with the goal of helping claimants access their settlement proceeds more efficiently and quickly. The company plans to continue leveraging technology and top tier talent to enhance customer service and offer new product lines and services. ARCHER's core offering is post-settlement Healthcare Lien Resolution Administration and QSF (Qualified Settlement Fund) Administration and payments processing for multiclaimant (mass tort and class action) litigation. Other services include claims administration, single event lien resolution, probate and bankruptcy coordination, release administration, medical records review, and plaintiff fact sheet and other intake/census preparation and management. ARCHER enables law firms to focus on their litigation while ensuring that critical pre-settlement and post-settlement administration documents, services, business analytics and reporting are handled efficiently and effectively.

POSITION SUMMARY

As a Senior DevOps Engineer, you will play a crucial role in building, deploying, and managing our cloud infrastructure, CI/CD pipelines, and ensuring the efficient and secure delivery of high-quality software products in alignment with business requirements and customer expectations. You will collaborate closely with development, QA, and other stakeholders to streamline workflows, improve automation, and optimize system reliability and scalability. The ideal candidate will bring expertise in DevOps practices, strong problemsolving skills, and the ability to effectively communicate and collaborate across crossfunctional teams while maintaining DevOps culture and practices across the organization.

KEY RESPONSIBILITIES
Design, implement, and maintain CI/CD pipelines for multiple software applications and environments using Jenkins, facilitating faster and more reliable software releases.
Implement and uphold robust security measures, including identity and access management, encryption, and adherence to relevant standards (e.g., SOC 2, HIPAA).
Optimize cloud resource utilization and implement cost-saving strategies across the infrastructure.
Maintain comprehensive documentation of systems, processes, and best practices.
Collaborate with software developers, quality assurance engineers, and IT professionals to ensure seamless deployment, automation, and management of software infrastructure.
Automate software deployment, configuration, and maintenance processes to minimize manual intervention and enhance system efficiency.
Develop and maintain automation scripts and tools using PowerShell, Groovy, Python, and other scripting languages.
Utilize version control systems like Git to manage code, ensuring collaboration and codebase integrity, and implement Artifactory for managing artifacts, binaries, and packages, such as Nexus and JFrog.
Create and maintain monitoring, logging, and alerting systems using tools like New Relic and Sentry to ensure high availability and performance.
Manage and optimize cloud infrastructure on AWS and Azure, including provisioning and configuring virtual machines, containers (Docker, Kubernetes), and storage solutions like Amazon S3.
Implement security best practices, including access controls, encryption, and vulnerability scanning tools like SonarQube and MEND, to safeguard company data and systems.
Troubleshoot and resolve infrastructure and application issues to ensure minimal downtime and disruption to business operations.
Configure and manage networking components (TCP/IP, DNS, load balancers, firewalls) and support databases and datastores, such as SQL Server and Redis, to ensure optimal performance and security.
Stay informed about industry trends and emerging technologies, assess their potential impact, and recommend adoption where appropriate to enhance software infrastructure.
Collaborate in an Agile environment using project management and workflow tools like Jira to align efforts with team goals and objectives.

REQUIRED SKILLS AND QUALIFICATIONS

Bachelors degree in Computer Science, Software Engineering, or a related field; Masters degree preferred.
6+ years of experience in DevOps engineering.
Expert knowledge of version control systems, such as Git, and CI/CD tools like Jenkins.
Proficient with Git CLI, Git branching and merging strategies, release management, and merge conflict resolution.
Proven expertise in languages like PowerShell, Groovy, and Python.
Expert knowledge of managing IIS, Windows Services, and NPM.
Proficiency in using Infrastructure as Code tools beyond Terraform, such as AWS CloudFormation or Azure Resource Manager templates.
Experience with repository management tools such as Nexus for managing and organizing software artifacts.
Experience with monitoring and logging tools such as New Relic and Sentry.
Solid understanding of networking concepts, including TCP/IP, DNS, load balancers, and firewalls (CloudFlare).
Experience in implementing SAST and SCA tools such as SonarQube and MEND in the deployment pipeline.
Experience supporting databases or datastores such as SQL Server, Elastic Server, and Redis.
Experience with cloud infrastructure such as AWS and Azure, with prior experience in Amazon S3 and serverless computing platforms like AWS Lambda or Azure Functions.
Experience with containerization technologies such as Docker and orchestration tools like Kubernetes for deploying, scaling, and managing containerized applications.
Proficiency in managing and optimizing Elastic Search deployments to ensure efficient and scalable search functionalities within the infrastructure.
Experience with project management and workflow tools such as Agile and Jira.
Knowledge of security best practices and the ability to implement security controls at the infrastructure level, plus compliance with relevant standards (e.g., SOC 2, HIPAA).
Strong understanding of software development methodologies, agile practices, and the software development lifecycle.
Excellent understanding of data structures and object-oriented principles.
Ability to provide regular updates, system solutions, and communicate issues to the management team.
Constantly strive to learn new technologies and stay up-to-date in the rapidly changing industry.
Excellent communication skills with the ability to effectively collaborate with cross-functional teams.
Strong problem-solving skills and attention to detail.
Education: UG: Any Graduate
Key Skills: Powershell, SQL Server, Jenkins, Git, Docker, Aws Cloudformation, Nexus, Networking Concepts, Sast, Ci/Cd, Version Control, NPM, MEND, Azure Resource Manager Arm Templates, Firewall, IIS, Window Service, Terraform, Aws Lambda, New Relic, SonarQube, Sentry, Elastic Search, Kubernetes

Job Description:
Role & responsibilities:
Azure Infrastructure Management: Provision and manage infrastructure resources in the Azure cloud using tools like Azure Resource Manager (ARM) templates, Terraform, and Azure DevOps.
Automation: Develop and implement automation scripts and tools to streamline processes such as code deployment, system updates, and configuration management using Azure DevOps Pipelines and Azure Automation.
Continuous Integration/Continuous Deployment (CI/CD): Design, implement, and maintain CI/CD pipelines using Azure DevOps to ensure efficient and reliable software delivery.
Development: Work as integrated part of the development team, participate in all activities including development and maintenance of microservices using .NET technologies.
Collaboration: Work closely with developers, testers, and system administrators to ensure seamless integration and deployment of code changes on Azure.
Monitoring and Troubleshooting: Monitor system performance and troubleshoot issues using Azure Monitor, Azure Log Analytics, and other Azure-native tools to ensure the stability and reliability of applications and infrastructure.
Security: Implement and maintain security best practices to protect the Azure infrastructure and applications from vulnerabilities and threats using Azure Security Center and Azure Policy.
Documentation: Create and maintain documentation for Azure infrastructure, processes, and tools to ensure knowledge sharing and continuity.
Azure DevOps Engineers focus on automating, streamlining, and optimizing the data pipeline development lifecycle using Azure DevOps tools. Their responsibilities involve configuring and managing Continuous Integration/Continuous Deployment (CI/CD) pipelines, implementing Infrastructure as Code (IaC), source control management.

Tools & Techs:
Azure DevOps, Azure Data Pipelines, Azure Repos (Git), ARM templates, Azure Monitor.
Experience with deploying Azure data services like - Azure Data Factory, Azure Databricks, Azure SQL Database, Azure Synapse Analytics, Azure Kubernetes Service, Prometheus, Grafana.

Technical Expertise:
Configuring and overseeing CI/CD pipelines, specifying Infrastructure as Code (IaC) through tools like Azure Resource Manager (ARM) templates, automating testing and deployment procedures, establishing monitoring and logging systems and fine-tuning deployment workflows.


Preferred candidate profile:
    • Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Information Technology, or a related field
    • Previous experience in a DevOps or similar role with a focus on Azure in a fast-paced environment.
    • Proficiency in scripting languages (e.g., PowerShell, Bash), configuration management tools (e.g., Ansible, Puppet), and CI/CD tools (e.g., Azure DevOps, Jenkins).
    • Extensive experience with Microsoft Azure services, including Azure Resource Manager (ARM), Azure DevOps, Azure Kubernetes Service (AKS), and Azure Functions.
    • Experience in programming languages such as C#, .NET, React.
    • Experience working with AMQP, MQTT and microservices
    • Strong analytical and problem-solving skills to troubleshoot and resolve complex issues on the Azure platform.
    • Excellent communication and teamwork skills to work effectively with cross-functional teams.
    • Ability to adapt to changing technologies and learn new tools and techniques as needed.
    • Experience working in an agile environment with agile methodologies.
Education: UG: Any Graduate
Key Skills: Azure Data Factory, Azure Cloud, Azure Databricks, Azure Devops

Job Title: Scheduled Walk-in Drive For DevOps Engineer on 8th- Sep , Bangalore
Job Description:
Role & responsibilities
About the Role When you join AVEVAs Research & Development team, you are joining a global team of over 2000 engineers and computer scientists.
We work on over 75 leading industrial automation and engineering products. Our focus, passion, and collaboration help us to deliver innovative, high-quality, and secure industrial software that delights our customers.
At AVEVA, were all about limitless possibilities. Are you? AVEVAs Cloud DevOps (CDO) function combines software development and IT operations to provide continuous integration and delivery of cloud-enabled products and solutions.
Responsible for deployment and continuous monitoring to ensure various cloud-specific customer requirements/SLAs are met. As a Cloud Operations Developer, you will work with developers and support colleagues to Diagnose and resolve cloud infrastructure incidents to optimize uptime.
Continually improve and develop AVEVAs cloud solutions, including release and deployment processes and pipelines.
Additionally, Cloud Operations Developers work closely with development and portfolio colleagues to bring new solutions to the cloud, following a standard framework to ensure solutions are operationally secure, stable, and scalable.
The global 24x7x365 nature of the team means active participation as part of a ‘follow the sun’ shared team on-call Rota, and business priorities may require work outside of the standard day. In this role you will: Provide timely and effective response to incidents to minimize the impact on our customers and keep colleagues updated as required. Provide support for AVEVA cloud solutions, with a keen focus on optimization and automation.
Work with development teams to advise and contribute to improvements to operational stability, security, cost management, and reporting requirements for our cloud solutions. Provide feedback and input to development teams to continually improve the operational performance of cloud solutions.
Oversee cloud deployments to ensure successful implementation, track and report progress, resolve or escalate release issues.
